meanings.definition: A young man in ancient Greece, typically between the ages of 18 and 20, undergoing military training.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Greece, the ephebos would train hard to become skilled warriors.
meanings.sent2: The ephebos in the village were eager to learn the ways of combat.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous ephebos decided to have a mock battle in the field.
meanings.sent4: His determination in training made him an ephebos of exceptional strength.
meanings.sent5: The ephebos' dedication to his military education was unmatched.

meanings.sent1: The ephebos enjoyed playing games with his friends in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: As a curious ephebos, he explored the forest near his home.
meanings.sent3: The ephebos accidentally knocked over a stack of books in the library.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the room, marking him as the liveliest ephebos around.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous ephebos always found a way to have fun with his pals.
